"DirectDraw" should be disabled wherever possible to avoid operating system failures caused by incompatible games using "DirectX" and accessing the video and memory hardware. This control is a requirement if the system is to meet the C2 Security Standard.

criterion.comment: Timeout must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Do not allow exceptions" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Do not allow exceptions" parameter determines whether the Windows Firewall will allow exceptions to its rules. Exceptions allow specific types of traffic to be accepted by the Firewall, even when it has been set to block all types of traffic. It is recommended that this parameter be enabled, to prevent attackers from creating rules in order to breach security for future attacks.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
DoNotAllowExcept from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Define program exceptions" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Define program exceptions" parameter determines whether the Windows Firewall will allow the program exceptions list to be viewed and altered. When enabled, users can add or remove programs as they wish. This way, the Windows Firewall will open any service port solicited by the requesting program. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, to prevent attackers from being able to open security breaches on the computer for future attacks.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
DefineProgExcept from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Allow remote administration exception" parameter should be disabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Allow remote administration exception" parameter determines whether the Windows Firewall will be allowed to create exceptions for the remote administration of the computer. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, in order to prevent attackers from obtaining unauthorized access to the client computer, as when an exception for remote administration is allowed, the Windows Firewall will keep the TCP 135 and 445 ports open and allow local programs to open ports dynamically.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
RemoteAdmExcept from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Allow file and printer sharing exception" parameter should be disabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Allow file and printer sharing exception" parameter determines whether the Windows Firewall will allow the client computer to share printers or files. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, in order to prevent attackers from gaining unauthorized access to the computer through ports opened by shared resources.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
PrinterSharingExcept from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Allow ICMP exceptions" parameter should be disabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Allow ICMP exceptions" parameter specifies that Windows Firewall will allow ICMP messages to be sent and received. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, in order to prevent attackers from launching Denial-of-Service attacks by sending ICMP messages.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
ICMP exceptions from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as disabled

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Allow Remote Desktop exception" parameter should be disabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Allow Remote Desktop exception" parameter specifies that Windows Firewall will allow access to the Windows XP Remote Desktop service. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, in order to prevent attackers from exploiting vulnerabilities through port 3389 - the port used by the Remote Desktop - and consequently gain unauthorized access to the computer.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
RemoteDesktop from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Allow UPnP framework exception" parameter should be disabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Allow UPnP framework exception" parameter specifies that Windows Firewall will allow "Plug and Play" messages sent by network devices (routers, firewalls and others) to be received. It is recommended that this parameter be disabled, in order to prevent attackers from launching attacks through TCP port 2869 and UDP 1900 - both used by this service - and consequently gain unauthorized access to the computer or render it unavailable.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
UPnPframe from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP's "Windows Firewall: Prohibit unicast response to multicast or broadcast request" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Prohibit unicast response to multicast or broadcast request" parameter specifies that Windows Firewall will block the receiving of replies to "broadcast" and "multicast" messages. It is recommended that this parameter be enabled, in order to prevent attackers from carrying out Denial-of-Service attacks using these types of messages, or from mapping a network to discover which computers are present on it.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
FirewallProhibit from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1

metadata.title: The "EnhancedSecurityLevel" parameter in the Registry should be set to "1".
metadata.description: The "EnhancedSecurityLevel" parameter only allows the Object Manager to modify the attributes of objects of the kernel in the object table if the requester's previous mode was the kernel mode. It is recommended that this parameter be set to "1" in order to prevent attackers from making unauthorized modifications to Kernel objects.

criterion.comment: EnhancedSecurityLevel must be configured as 1

metadata.title: The "SFCDisable" parameter in the Registry should be set to "0".
metadata.description: The "SFCDisable" parameter determines whether the Windows File Protection mechanism will be enabled or not. WFP runs in the background protecting system files and preventing anyone from overwriting them. If this mechanism detects that any protected system file has been altered, it automatically replaces the altered version of the file with the original version without the modifications. Should an attacker be capable of altering a protected system file, he would be able to include malicious code in the file to breach system security and thus facilitate future attacks. Also, undue modifications to these files may lead to a decrease in the performance of the system or even to its unavailability. For this reason, the Windows File Protection mechanism should be enabled.

criterion.comment: SFCDisable must be configured as 0

metadata.title: Windows XP should be set up to send an alert when a fatal error occurs.
metadata.description: When Windows XP systems are set up to send an alert to the Administrator in case a fatal error occurs, corrective actions can be taken sooner. This reduces the time the system remains unavailable, amongst other potential benefits.

criterion.comment: registry key exist?
SendAlert must be configured different from 0

metadata.title: The "AutoAdminLogon" parameter in the Registry should be set to "0".
metadata.description: The "AutoAdminLogon" parameter determines whether the operating system will automatically use the administrator's credentials for authentication, without requiring user intervention. It is recommended that this parameter be set to "0" in order to prevent attackers from gaining access to the system's console with administrative privileges.

criterion.comment: AutoAdminLogon must be configured as 0

metadata.title: The "KeepAliveTime" parameter in the Registry should be set to "300000".
metadata.description: The "KeepAliveTime" parameter specifies the time TCP will wait before sending a keep-alive packet in order to check whether idle connections are still active. If the remote computer is still connected to the network, it will respond to the packet. If there is no response, the connection will be terminated. Too many idle connections could lead to a decrease in performance. In the absence of a limit to the no-activity period, an attacker who is able to connect to the available applications will also be able to launch a denial-of-service attack by setting up a very large number of connections.

criterion.comment: registry key exist?
KeepAliveTime must be configured as 300000

metadata.title: The "Devices: Unsigned driver installation behavior" parameter should be set to "Do not allow installation" or "Warn but allow installation".
metadata.description: Device "drivers" are run with high privileges on the system, and therefore it is essential that they function in an appropriate way. If malicious code acting as a "driver", or a "driver" incompatible with Windows, is installed, the system may be rendered unavailable. The "driver signing" feature digitally checks if the integrity of the driver has not been compromised and if it was tested on Windows. If possible, the installation of "drivers" unsigned by the "Windows Hardware Quality Lab" (WHQL) should not be allowed. Installation may be allowed in extreme cases, as long as the user is notified that the "driver" is unsigned. In these cases, only "drivers" from totally reliable sources should be installed.

criterion.comment: Policy must be configured different from 0

metadata.title: The "CreateCrashDump" parameter in the Registry should be set to "0".
metadata.description: The "CreateCrashDump" parameter determines whether "Dr. Watson for Windows" (the native Windows program error debugger) will transfer the contents of computer memory to a file when programs fail or generate any type of error. Depending on the moment the dumping takes place, sensitive information such as passwords, for example, may be stored on the file created. To prevent attackers from obtaining unauthorized access to sensitive information by reading these "dump" files, their creation should be disabled.

criterion.comment: CreateCrashDump must be configured as 0

metadata.title: The "Auto" parameter in the Registry should be set to "0".
metadata.description: The "Auto" parameter determines whether the system program debugger will be executed automatically when errors occur during the running of an application. This way, an application that is running in privileged mode will be able to, through the system program debugger, obtain high privileges on the system. To prevent attackers from gaining unauthorized access to the system, it is recommended that the system program debugger be stopped from running automatically.

criterion.comment: Auto must be configured as 0

metadata.title: The "UseBasicAuth" parameter in the Registry should be set to "0".
metadata.description: The "UseBasicAuth" parameter determines whether the system will allow users to use WebDav service's "BasicAuth" user authentication method. This form of authentication sends the user credentials in cleartext (user name and password) to the server. As a result, this information can be easily viewed by attackers and later used to carry out attacks. For this reason, it is recommended that the system be configured to not use WebDav's "BasicAuth" form of authentication.

criterion.comment: UseBasicAuth must be configured as 0

metadata.title: The Windows XP "RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: When enabled, the "RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication" parameter determines that only authenticated clients will be allowed to connect to the computer acting as the RPC Server. To prevent unauthorized users from gaining undue access to the RPC server, it is recommended that access to it be authenticated.

criterion.comment: registry key exist?
EnableAuthEpResolution must be configured as 1

metadata.title: The Windows XP "Disable remote Desktop Sharing" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: Whenever enabled, the "Disable remote Desktop Sharing" parameter prevents the desktop from being shared through NetMeeting. It is recommended to enable this parameter so as to prevent attackers from gaining unauthorized access to the system by sharing the desktop area.

criterion.comment: registry key exist?
NoRDS must be configured as 1

metadata.title: The maximum size of the audit logs used by Windows XP's Windows Firewall should be specified.
metadata.description: By correctly specifying the maximum size of the log file used by Windows XP's Windows Firewall, the risk of unnecessarily taking up disk space is reduced. If a maximum size for this files is not determined, available disk space could become so reduced that it would no longer be possible to write to the audit files. Traceability would be lost and the system could become unavailable due to a lack of sufficient disk space. For this reason, a maximum size for this file should be set.

criterion.comment: registry key exist?
registry key exist?
A maximum size for the audit file of the Windows Firewall must be set
A maximum size for the audit file of the Windows Firewall must be set

metadata.title: The Windows Firewall auditing functions should be set up to log relevant security events.
metadata.description: If Windows Firewall events are logged, administrators will be able to use the logged data to take necessary action in case of attacks against, or any unusual situation with respect to, the system. After having set up the auditing functions in accordance with this control, events referring to the packets dropped by the Windows Firewall will be logged.

criterion.comment: Collect Service Pack version
EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
Collect LogFilePath from Domain and Standard Profile
LogDroppedPackets from Domain and Standard Profile must be set as enable

metadata.title: The Windows XP "Windows Firewall: Prohibit notifications" parameter should be enabled.
metadata.description: The "Windows Firewall: Prohibit notifications" parameter determines whether the Windows Firewall will allow system users to decide between blocking and permitting the opening of ports when requested by applications. When a port is requested, the Windows Firewall generates a message which prompts the user to choose between keeping the port blocked and allowing it to be opened. System ports that are unnecessarily opened represent security breaches and can be used by attackers to gain unauthorized access to the system. For this reason, the Windows Firewall should not seek user decisions on opening system ports. This way, all ports will be kept blocked until the administrator unblocks them.

criterion.comment: EnableFirewall from Domain and Standard Profile must be configured as 1
Collect Service Pack version
DisableNotifications from Domain and Standard Profile must be set as enable

metadata.title: The "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients" parameter should be set as follows: "Require Message Integrity", "Message Confidentiality", "Require NTLMv2 session security" and "Require 128-bit encryption".
metadata.description: The "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients" parameter allows the security configuration of the communication between applications. By default, this setting is enabled in an insecure format as it is not encrypted in any way. Whenever possible, encryption is recommended in client-side communications between applications, so as not to jeopardize sensitive information in transit. Otherwise, this information may lose its integrity.

criterion.comment: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients must be configured as: Require Message Integrity, Message Confidentiality,Require NTLMv2 session security and Require 128-bit encryption

metadata.title: The "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers" parameter should be set as follows: "Require Message Integrity", "Message Confidentiality", "Require NTLMv2 session security" and "Require 128-bit encryption".
metadata.description: The "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers" parameter allows the security configuration between applications. By default, this setting is enabled in an insecure format as it is not encrypted in any way. Whenever possible, encryption is recommended in server-side communications between applications, so as not to jeopardize sensitive information in transit. Otherwise, this information may lose its integrity.

criterion.comment: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients must be configured as: Require Message Integrity, Message Confidentiality,Require NTLMv2 session security and Require 128-bit encryption

metadata.title: The "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Asr\Commands" Registry key should have its permission set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Asr\Commands" Registry key stores the automatic system recovery commands. To prevent attackers from making unauthorized changes that could lead to security breaches being exploited in future attacks, the permissions on this key should be set up in such a way as to block unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: The Registry key should have its permission set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
The Registry key should have its permission set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%ProgramFiles%" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%ProgramFiles%" directory is the location where applications are installed on the computer. If unauthorized users had write access to this directory, they would be able to modify the files of installed applications in a way that could lead to security breaches or to the unavailability of the affected applications. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %ProgramFiles% - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %ProgramFiles% - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %ProgramFiles% - Users = Read and Execute.
SID's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%ProgramFiles%\Resource Pro Kit" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%ProgramFiles%\Resource Pro Kit" directory is the location where tools installed with the Windows Resource Kit are stored. These tools are normally used for system management. Should unauthorized users have access to these tools, they would be able to make several modifications to the system in a way that could lead to security breaches or to the unavailability of the system. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: %ProgramFiles%\Resource Pro Kit folder exists?
Collect permissions of %ProgramFiles%\Resource Pro Kit - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control
SID's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32" directory is where system DLLs, device drivers and executable programs are stored. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to either remove or modify them, in a way that could lead to the unavailability of the system, for example. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32 - Administrators Full, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32 - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32 - Users = Read and Execute.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\config" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\config" directory is where the "HIVE" files are stored. These files are used at the startup of the operating system to load the system's Registry. They are read and the Registry tree is created. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to make several modifications to the system's Registry in a way that could lead to security breaches or to the unavailability of the system. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\config - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\config - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\dllcache" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\dllcache" directory is where copies of the operating system's protected files are stored. These files are used by the System File Checker to repair system files that have been damaged or altered. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to make changes, such as inserting malicious code into them. Also, if one of these copies is removed, the system will no longer be capable of replacing damaged or maliciously altered files, and this could cause system interruptions. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\dllcache - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\dllcache - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\ias" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\ias" directory is used to store databases of the Internet Authentication Service. These databases store information regarding user accounts. Should an unauthorized user have access to these files, he would be able to obtain access to sensitive information related to users, such as user credentials. The malicious user could then use this information to gain unauthorized access to the system. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: check if %SystemRoot%\system32\ias folder exist
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\ias - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\ias - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\spool\PRINTERS" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\spool\PRINTERS" directory is where the spool used by the printers installed on the system is stored. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to access documents sent to the printer through the computer. They could also create false printing spool files in a way that would compromise system performance or lead to system interruptions. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\spool\PRINTERS - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\spool\PRINTERS - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\spool\PRINTERS - Users = Traverse folder, Read attributes, Read extended attributes, Create Files and Create folders.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\Default User" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\Default User" directory is used to store the profile that serves as a kind of template when new user profiles are added. Therefore, all files in the Default User profile will be copied to new user profiles. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to view, modify and remove files belonging to the Default User profile. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\Default User - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\Default User- Read and Execute permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\Default User- sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson" directory is where the application error log file used by the "Dr.Watson" tool is stored. To prevent malicious users from accessing these files and having them removed, it is recommended that NTFS permissions on this directory be set in a way that prevents unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson file exists?
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson - Users = Traverse folder,Create File, Create folders, Read and Execute
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%" directory is used to store the operating system's installation files. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to have them removed, causing the unavailability of the system, or altered, by inserting malicious code in the files, for example. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot% - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot% - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot% - Users = Read and Execute.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\$NtServicePackUninstall$" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\$NtServicePackUninstall$" directory is used to store old versions of operating system files. These files are needed when a Service Pack has to be uninstalled for any reason. To prevent these files from being altered or removed, which would make it impossible to uninstall Service Packs, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\$NtServicePackUninstall$ - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\$NtServicePackUninstall$ - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\CSC" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\CSC" directory stores the files used when the "offline folders" feature is utilized. This directory serves as a cache. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to view, modify and remove files stored there. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\CSC - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\CSC - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\security" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\security" directory stores the security templates that can be used on the system. In addition, this directory also stores the databases used during analyses of the implementation of these templates. Should unauthorized users have access to these files, they would be able to modify the parameters present in the security templates in a way that could lead to security breaches or to the unavailability of the system. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\security - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\security - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\repair" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\repair" directory is used to store a backup copy of the SAM password database as well as other important system files and components. All these files are extremely important when the system needs to be repaired. Should an unauthorized user have access to this directory, he would be able to access the user passwords and other sensitive information. For these reasons, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\repair - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\repair - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\Temp" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\Temp" directory stores the temporary files used by the system. These temporary files may contain sensitive information. To help prevent malicious users from accessing sensitive information, it is recommended that NTFS permissions on this directory be set in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Temp - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Temp - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Temp% - Users = Traverse folder, Create Files and Create folders
Sid's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\ntbackup.exe" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\ntbackup.exe" program is used to back up files present on the system. Should unauthorized users be allowed to run this program, they would be able to copy any file on the system. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this file should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\ntbackup.exe - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\ntbackup.exe - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\rcp.exe" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\rcp.exe" file enables remote users to copy files. Should unauthorized users be allowed to run this program, they would be able to make remote copies of any file on the system. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this file should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rcp.exe - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rcp.exe - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\rexec.exe" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\rexec.exe" file enables remote execution of operating system commands. Should unauthorized users be allowed to run this program, they would be able to execute system commands, which could lead to security breaches being exploited in future attacks. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this file should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rexec.exe - System and Administrators: Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rexec.exe - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\rsh.exe" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\rsh.exe" file enables remote execution of an operating system shell. Should unauthorized users be allowed to run this program, they would be able to access an operating system shell to run commands on the system, which could lead to security breaches being exploited in future attacks. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this file should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rsh.exe - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\rsh.exe - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\autoexec.bat", "%SystemDrive%\config.sys", "%SystemDrive%\io.sys" and "%SystemDrive%\msdos.sys" files should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\autoexec.bat", "%SystemDrive%\config.sys", "%SystemDrive%\io.sys" and "%SystemDrive%\msdos.sys" files are used when DOS applications are started. Should an unauthorized user have access to these files, he would be able to have them modified or removed. As a result, it will no longer be possible to run DOS applications on the computer. For this reason, NTFS permissions on these files should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\autoexec.bat , SystemDrive%\config.sys , %SystemDrive%\io.sys , %SystemDrive%\msdos.sys - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\autoexec.bat , SystemDrive%\config.sys , %SystemDrive%\io.sys , %SystemDrive%\msdos.sys - Read and Execute permission

tdetect.com", "%SystemDrive%
tldr" and "%SystemDrive%

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\regedit.exe" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\regedit.exe" program is used to modify the parameters in Registry keys. Should unauthorized users be allowed to run this program, they would be able to change the values of Registry parameters. If any undue change is made, security may be breached, facilitating future attacks. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this file should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\regedit.exe - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\regedit.exe - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\appmgmt" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\appmgmt" directory stores files used to manage the applications installed on the system. These files are utilized when the applications are installed. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify and remove files stored there, making it impossible to install or uninstall software applications. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\appmgmt - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\appmgmt - Read and Execute permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\appmgmt -sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\MsDTC" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\MsDTC" directory stores the Microsoft Distribution Transaction Coordinator's log files. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify and remove files stored there. As a result, these files would no longer be useful in the event of a security incident when viewing their content would be critical. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of SystemRoot%\system32\MsDTC - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control.
Collect permissions of SystemRoot%\system32\MsDTC - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of SystemRoot%\system32\MsDTC - Users = Read and Execute.
Sid's Verification Administrators, SYSTEM, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy" directory stores local Group Policy objects. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify the files in there to breach system security. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: '%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy' folder exists?
Collect the permissions of '%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy' - Full Control permission
Collect the permissions of '%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy' - Read, List, Read and Execute permission
Check SID's of '%SystemRoot%\system32\GroupPolicy' folder

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\NtmsData" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\NtmsData" directory stores the Removable Storage database. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify and remove database files in there. As a result, new removable storage devices may not work properly. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\NtmsData - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\NtmsData - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\system32\Setup" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\system32\Setup" directory stores DLLs used during the installation and setup of some applications. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify and remove files stored there. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\Setup - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\Setup - Read and Execute permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\system32\Setup - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%" root should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%" root is where the operating system is installed. It stores important system initialization and configuration files. Should unauthorized users have access to this drive, they would be able to modify and remove files stored there. This would compromise the startup of the operating system, preventing its use. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this drive should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - CREATOR OWNER = None
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - Users = Read and Execute
SID's Verification - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control, CREATOR OWNER, Users.

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings" directory is used to store the system users profiles. Each user profile is comprised of its configutation files as well as its respective user's confidential documents. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify how a user profile is configured, view sensitive information, etc. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - Read and Execute permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive% - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users" directory is used to store the user profile that is common to all users. Any modification to this profile will be reflected on all other profiles on the system. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify how user profiles are configured, etc. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users - Read and Execute permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemRoot%\Registration" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemRoot%\Registration" directory stores registration files used by the Load Balancing component and which are accessed by COM+ applications. Should unauthorized users have access to this directory, they would be able to modify and remove files stored there, making them unavailable. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Registration - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Registration - Read permission
Collect permissions of %SystemRoot%\Registration - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log" file should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log" file stores error log records generated by the Dr. Watson tool. To prevent malicious users from accessing this file and having it removed, it is recommended that NTFS permissions on this file be set to block unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log file exists?
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log - Full Control permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log - None permission
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\DrWatson\drwtsn32.log - sid's

metadata.title: NTFS permissions on the "%SystemDrive%\Temp" directory should be set up in such a way as to prevent unauthorized access.
metadata.description: The "%SystemDrive%\Temp" directory is used to store temporary files. Should an unauthorized user have access to these files, he would be able to access sensitive information. For this reason, NTFS permissions on this directory should be set up in a way that blocks unauthorized access.

criterion.comment: %SystemDrive%\Temp folder exists?
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Temp - Administrators, SYSTEM = Full Control
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Temp - CREATOR OWNER = None.
Collect permissions of %SystemDrive%\Temp - Users = Traverse folder, Create File and Create folders
